content.description: Corn is a crop that grows best in soil that drains well.
content.question: Which of the following soils is best suited to grow corn?

choices.label: Clay because it has at least <math alttext="45%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> clay so it absorbs water very well.
Silt loam because it is about <math alttext="80%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> silt and has low amounts of sand.
Sandy loam because it has large amounts of sand and less than <math alttext="20%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> clay.
Silty clay loam because it has all three soil components.

content.answer: Sandy loam because it has large amounts of sand and less than <math alttext="20%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> clay.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
